What's Happening

  1. Mayor Brown Kicks off Earth Month 2019

    Mayor Brown announces City of Buffalo’s curbside rate has nearly doubled as he kicked off earth month 2019 Read on...

  2. Apply to start a career in the Buffalo Police Department

    Submit your application to join the Buffalo Police Department! Applications Due: May 22, 2019. Exam Date June 29, 2019. Apply today! Read on...

  3. City of Buffalo 2019 Bulk Trash Schedule

    Each property is limited to a pile of trash that is 12 feet long, 3 feet wide, 3 feet high. Read on...

  4. Spring 2019 Buffalo Citizens Police Academy

    Applications now available to Buffalo residents for the spring 2019 Police and Community Together (P.A.C.T.) Buffalo Citizen Police Academy starting Wednesday, May 1, 2019. Read on...

  5. Love your Block Mini-Grant Applications Available Now!

    Love Your Block is a program in which volunteer-led community groups compete for a chance to win cash grants up to $1,000, as well as project planning assistance, to beautify and transform a public space in Buffalo. Read on...

  6. Mayor Brown Invites you to Celebrate the Easter Season at the Broadway Market

    Easter Season at The Broadway Market runs from April 5th to April 22nd. Read on...

  7. 2019 Annual Action Plan Formulation

    Buffalo residents are invited to get involved into the community development process and work with us on formulating the annual action plan for the U.S. Dept. of Housing and Urban Development (HUD) entitlement funds that benefit our community. Read on...

  8. Mayor Brown Launches Civic Innovation Eco Challenge - Powered by AT&T

    A competition offering $12,000 in prize money for technology-based solutions to promote recycling and environmental efforts across the City of Buffalo. Read on...

  9. City of Buffalo User Fee Information

    Click here to view updated fee schedules and payment options. Additional Info...

  10. Northland Corridor Redevelopment Project

    An east-side industrial park focused on high-growth manufacturing and energy sectors! Click here for updates!
/CivicAlerts.aspx

Meet the Mayor
Week in Review

Stay Connected

  1. Stay Informed
    Latest News

  1. Mayor Brown Details Progress on First Phase of $6.3 Million 'Allen Street Complete' Project

    Allen Street Complete is a multi-year overhaul of Allen Street which will improve traffic flow and aesthetics fro drivers, pedestrians and bicyclists Read on...

  2. Mayor Brown Announces Completion of The Broadway Market Free Public WIFI Installation

    City of Buffalo, Blue Wireless Provide Free Service to Residents, Businesses and Visitors at the historic Broadway Market Read on...

  3. Mayor Brown Announces City of Buffalo’s Curbside Rate Nearly Doubled as he Kicked Off Earth Month

    Mayor Byron W. Brown today kicked off Earth Month 2019 by announcing the City’s 34andMore recycling rate increased to 29.3 percent in 2018, nearly double the 15.9 percent rate when the city switched to single stream curbside recycling in 2012. Read on...
